The digital health revolution, Is the right future for pharma, a keynote session that will take a close look at the new healthcare digital innovations such as telemedicine, digital therapeutics, and data analytics in patient engagement, drug development, and overall health-care outcomes.
 Understanding Digital Health: The term digital health is broad, referencing the very wide range of technologies that impact health and healthcare delivery. Mobile health applications, wearable devices, telehealth platforms, and digital therapeutics are parts of the spectrum.
 Learners will learn how these technologies blur the landscape of patient care and contribute to real-time monitoring- a feature that will help advance proactive health management. Telemedicine and Remote Patient Monitoring: Telemedicine is becoming a daily necessity for the provision of healthcare services, especially during the COVID-19 pandemic. 
This session will describe how the advent of telemedicine has made opportunities accessible to care, especially to patients who live in remote locations or those suffering from mobility issues. The participant will best understand the implementation best practices of telehealth solutions and also understand that remote patient monitoring indeed plays a significant role in chronic disease management. 
Digital Therapeutics: The term 'Digital Therapeutics' describes evidence-based interventions administered through software that can prevent, manage, or treat a medical condition. 
This session will consist of successful case studies and clinical evidence regarding the use of digital therapeutics in various therapeutic areas, from mental health to diabetes management and drug addiction treatment. 
The participants will be informed about regulatory considerations and the role of digital therapeutics in current traditional treatment pathways. Data Analytics and 
Patient Engagement: The focus of harnessing big data analytics will help in improving patient outcomes and optimizing drug development processes. In this session, big data analytics will explain the ability of exploring the needs of the patient, personalizing treatment and enhancing patient engagement. 
Attendees will learn innovative ways in how to apply data analytics in decision-making in clinical trials and post-market surveillance. 
Challenges and Future Directions: Although digital health seems quite promising, there are many challenges in dealing with regulatory hurdles, data-privacy issues, and enabling the interoperability of solutions across different digital health offerings. 
This session would explore such challenges and future directions by pharma of digital health along with collaboration opportunities between technology companies and pharmaceutical firms. 
In this final session, participants will appreciate the new role, which is yet to be defined in this industry, that digital health is set to play. 
Join us in discussions on some of the innovative solutions found for more effective care of patients, faster development of a more effective drug, and transformations in healthcare delivery.

metaKeywords: epigenetic drugs, epigenetics, gene regulation, cancer treatment, pharmaceutical development, therapeutic strategies, histone modification
metaDescription: Discover the potential of epigenetic drugs in transforming treatment strategies at the Pharma Global Summit. Learn about their mechanisms of action, therapeutic applications, and the future of epigenetic therapies in healthcare.
content:
Epigenetic drugs are the most revolutionary approach in the treatment of modern medicine, by targeting mechanisms that control gene expression without altering the underlying DNA sequence. 
This session will include health and disease, development of epigenetic therapy, and their potential applications toward the treatment of most diseases, especially cancer.
 Understanding Epigenetics Epigenetic modifications are heritable, meaning changes that affect gene expression but do not alter the DNA sequence. Mechanisms of epigenetic regulation include DNA methylation, histone modification, and non-coding RNA interactions. 
Attendees will be exposed to how such epigenetic alterations impact cellular function and form the basis for disease pathogenesis, a phenomenon very illustrative in cancer, neurological disorders, and metabolic diseases. Epigenetic 
drug mechanisms: Mechanisms of drugs include the reversal of aberrant epigenetic alterations so normal gene expression can be restored. A block of lectures will focus on the types of drugs-which include: DNA methyltransferase inhibitors, such as azacitidine and gemcitabine; and histone deacetylase inhibitors, among them vorinostat and romidepsin.
Such drugs, as part of their mechanism of action, inhibit specific therapeutic targets. Therapeutic Applications the therapeutic applications of drugs based on epigenetics are gigantic, particularly in oncology.
This session will be dedicated to clinical studies that established the efficacy of epigenetic therapy in various cancers. From hematological malignancies to solid tumors. Discussions will also be undertaken concerning a combination of epigenetic drugs with the conventional therapies for better treatment outcomes or to overcome drug resistance. 
Development challenges: Although the prospect of epigenetic drugs is very bright, several challenges emerge in their development. Among these challenges are specificity issues and off-target effects and after effects of modifying epigenetic marks for the long term. 
This session will identify challenges and the strategies currently being adopted in the pharmaceutical industry to mitigate risk and to improve therapeutic utility of epigenetic drugs. Future Directions: While epigenetic research progresses, so do new therapeutic strategies. 
The participants will learn of the future directions in epigenetic drug development including integration of epigenetic therapies with approaches from precision medicine, but also possibly the first steps into the use of epigenetic modulation for the treatment of non-cancerous diseases.
By the end of this session, participants will take away an integrated appreciation for epigenetic drugs within contemporary therapeutics and the transformative promise they hold for diseases. 
Learn about these revolutionary advancements in epigenetic therapies and their potential to change the face of future medicine.

metaKeywords: telepharmacy, digital health, remote pharmacy services, medication management, patient safety, pharmacy practice, telehealth
metaDescription: Explore the emerging field of telepharmacy at the Pharma Global Summit. Learn how remote pharmacy services enhance medication management, improve patient outcomes, and ensure safety in healthcare delivery.
content:
Patient Counselling and Education: The counselling and education of the patient are thought to be fundamental principles of pharmaceutical care. 
This session will discuss the possibility in virtual consultation regarding the proper information of the patients about their medicines, possible side effects, and ways of adherence to the treatment which is required. 
It will encompass best-practice management for remote consultations and appropriate uses of technology that may improve education and engagement of patients. However, there are some challenges along the way, like regulatory barriers, reimbursement issues, and even concerns about quality services delivered. 
This session will be informative to participants in unraveling the current regulatory landscape surrounding telepharmacy practices and strategies for overcoming these challenges so as to allow the delivery of high-quality pharmacy services. 
With the advancements in technology, the future of telepharmacy appears to be bright and straightforward in the acceptance process of remote healthcare service.
 Integration of AI in medication management and mobile health applications relating to nurse support for telepharmacy services will be discussed to understand the developing future of telepharmacy in view of dynamically changing patient needs and healthcare demands.
 Telepharmacy role in modern healthcare will be understood in this session by the participants. 
Join the session and get to see how telepharmacy is changing the way medication is managed as well as transforming patient care through innovation in digital solutions.

metaKeywords: neuropharmacology, neuroscience, drug action, neurotransmitters, CNS drugs, psychiatric disorders, neurological conditions
metaDescription: Discover the intricate field of neuropharmacology at the Pharma Global Summit. Learn about drug mechanisms in the central nervous system, their therapeutic applications, and advances in treating neurological and psychiatric disorders.
content:
Neuropharmacology is that branch of pharmacology which focuses on the effects that drugs have upon the nervous system. 
This lecture will discuss the mechanisms of drug action in the CNS and the role of neurotransmitters, and some therapeutic applications of neuropharmacological agents in the management of neurological and psychiatric disorders. 
Understanding Neuropharmacology: Neuropharmacology is the study of how drugs affect the brain and behavior. Class of CNS drugs include antidepressants, antipsychotics, anxiolytics, and stimulants. 
That session will look at the intricate inter-relationships between drugs and neurotransmitter systems, including Dopamine, Serotonin, Norepinephrine and GABA. 
Drug mechanisms of action: This includes understanding pharmacodynamics as well as the pharmacokinetic properties of neuropharmacology agents; these encompass knowledge that is considered central to an understanding of receptor binding, signal transduction, genetic influences on drug response, and the impact of environment on drug effects. 
Specific studies related to how a particular mechanism of drug action relates to a therapeutic effect or an adverse reaction in patients will be discussed. 
Therapeutic Applications: Neuropharmacology forms the core of treating a variety of neurological and psychiatric disorders. 
This session is going to be presented on the contemporary scenario for neuropharmacological therapy in depression, anxiety disorders, schizophrenia, epilepsy, and neurodegenerative diseases, including Alzheimer's and Parkinson's disease. 
This includes recent advances in drug development along with the importance of personalized medicine in improving treatment outcomes. Neuropharmacological Challenges. Although the field has made major advances and evolved into a well-established discipline, neuropharmacology still faces challenges including drug efficacy and safety as well as treatment-resistant conditions. 
This session will discuss challenges researchers and clinicians face in designing novel neuropharmacological agents or strategies to overcome these challenges, such as combination therapies and innovative drug delivery systems. 
Emerging Trends; Tomorrow's Neuropharmacology. The light is at the end of the tunnel as scientists are working on new drug targets, response to treatment biomarkers, and the integration of technology in drug development.
 The session on the emerging trends would be an eye-opener regarding gene therapy, personalized medicine, and artificial intelligence being incorporated in the drug development process, thereby changing our practice. 
At the end of the session, the participants would have gained ample understanding and insight into principles and applications of neuropharmacology in contemporary medicine.

metaKeywords: Drug patents, pharmaceutical innovation, intellectual property, access to medicines, patent law, generic drugs, market exclusivity
metaDescription: Explore the complexities of drug patents at the Infectious Disease Global Conference. Join experts to discuss the impact of patents on pharmaceutical innovation, access to medicines, and the future of drug development.
content:
Drug patents are said to be the lifeline of the pharmaceutical industry, that is, their mainstay as sources of legal protection for inventions and encouragement of innovation in the development of drugs. 
Conversely, on the other hand, finding a balance in intellectual property protection against access has proven a quite trying test. Topics to be covered include drug patents and their implications for pharmaceutical innovation, public health, and cross-border access to treatment. 
For example, a patent for a drug provides the years by which the owner shall be allowed to make, sell, and issue the pharmaceutical product. This is usually 20 years from the time of filing. 
This session will introduce key concepts of patent law: what qualifies a development as patentable, what a patent office does, and the process for patent application. Participants will understand how patents motivate pharmaceutical research and development. 
A company can recoup their investment costs because of this patent. Drug patents go a long way in encouraging innovation in the pharma sector. Patent protection can stimulate investment in research and development since knowledge generated by such studies enables finding new treatments for various diseases. 
In this session, participants will learn through the case study of successful drug development that has resulted from patent protection and the implication that future innovation in the area holds. Incentivizing creativity through patents on drugs, they increase the barriers to access and affordable medicines, particularly in poor and middle-income countries. 
This session will review patent exclusivity challenges that hinder increasing public health engagement with high drug prices, and participants will discuss improving access to essential medicines in light of generic drugs, patent pools, and international agreements, including TRIPS. 
Patent litigation is a prime factor of the pharmaceutical industry, more often presenting intricate legal battles over the issues of validity and infringement of patents. 
So, this session will cover the basics of patent litigation to understand the role of courts, patent holders, generic manufacturers, other recent trends in patent law about challenges towards patent validity, and efforts on patent reforms to balance the polices of innovation and access. 
Finally, future trends in drug patents under biotechnology advancement, personalized medicine, and global health initiative will form the culmination of this session. 
Emerging trends in patent law will be advanced, with respect to uses by artificial intelligence and digital health technologies in drug development. 
Its existence also raises the stakeholder relationship between government, healthcare providers, and the pharmaceutical industry to ensure that innovation meets its requirement of a very pervasive public health need.
